Pre-Game Insights: Bookmakers list the Blue Jays as -127 favorites on the moneyline, while giving the underdog Cardinals +107 moneyline odds.
An 8.5-run over/under has been set for the matchup.
Vladimir Guerrero Jr. and Alec Burleson will be among the stars on display.
The Blue Jays have entered the game as favorites 72 times this season and won 42, or 58.3%, of those games.
This season Toronto has won 24 of its 43 games, or 55.8%, when favored by at least -127 on the moneyline.
Oddsmakers have implied with the moneyline set for this matchup that the Blue Jays have a 55.9% chance to win.
The Cardinals have been chosen as underdogs in 77 games this year and have walked away with the win 38 times (49.4%) in those games.
This year, St. Louis has won 18 of 46 games when listed as at least +107 or worse on the moneyline.
The Cardinals have an implied victory probability of 48.3% according to the moneyline set by sportsbooks for this matchup.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Blue Jays went 2-1 across the three games they were favored on the moneyline in their last 10 matchups.
In their last 10 matchups (all had set totals), the Blue Jays combined with their opponents to hit the over on the run total four times.
The Blue Jays are 6-4-0 against the spread over their past 10 games.
Others: The Cardinals have played as underdogs in seven of their past 10 games and won three of those contests.
In their last 10 games with a total, the Cardinals and their opponents have combined to hit the over three times.
